text: Among soo many mosque which I been, Al-Mukminin is very impressed by it's designs to me. There is two spiral staircase make it unique. Natural cooling and a big fan enough to cool down the Hall. Anti-slip ceramic floors prevent people from falling after ablution. It's surrounded by trees and greenery. Feel peaceful praying in its.
Nice mosque but limited space as its an old mosque. But still its spacious and open. Feels very calm and natural. You will feel the peace of prayer.
Went there two times for hair raya pausa and hajji. Ample space. Nice and clean mosque

Masjid Al-Mukminin is a beautiful and spacious mosque located on Jurong East Street 21 in Singapore. The mosque's architecture is a blend of modern and traditional elements, creating a sense of grandeur and serenity. The exterior is sleek and modern, with clean lines and minimalist design, while the interior is adorned with intricate Islamic calligraphy and geometric patterns.

The congregation area is large and can accommodate a significant number of worshippers. The mosque's interior is well-lit and airy, with high ceilings and large windows that allow natural light to pour in. The carpeted floor is soft and comfortable, making it perfect for prayer and reflection.

The mosque's facilities are clean and well-maintained, with separate areas for men and women. The mosque also has a library, lecture halls, and other amenities that cater to the needs of the community. Overall, Masjid Al-Mukminin is a peaceful and spiritually enriching place that is perfect for prayer, reflection, and community activities.
A focal point for me in that neighbourhood. Mosque is striving always to provide quality services to the Muslims and neighbours in general there.
